title: Strictly's Catherine Tyldesley in tears after scandalous exit as fans threaten boycott
text:

Catherine Tyldesley has become the shock fifth celebrity to leave Strictly Come Dancing .

The former Coronation Street star and pro partner Johannes Radebe were sent home amid controversy on Halloween week.

Heartbroken Cath was left in tears after losing out in the dreaded dance-off to Mike Bushell and his partner Katya Jones, who were firm favourites to leave.

With the judges split over the decision, head judge Shirley Ballas chose to save the dancer with "stronger technical skills" and sent Catherine home.

With Dev Griffin's surprise exit still fresh in the memory, outraged Strictly fans are threatening to boycott the show.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

When asked by host Tess Daly about her time on the show, Catherine turned to partner Johannes with tears in her eyes.

The Corrie favourite said: "Him, yeah, he’s like my best friend. He’s just…oooh, (referring to eye make-up) it’s waterproof…just the opportunity to work with amazing people and get critiqued off amazing people.

"I never thought I’d say this, I’m going to keep it up because I fell in love with it! I’ve loved every second, this man has changed my life!"

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Johannes, who was given a celeb partner for the first time this series, said: "Okay Tess, the beautiful thing is that I need to thank Strictly Come Dancing for the opportunity…thank you."

The audience burst into applause during the emotional moment, before

He added: "Most of all, I want to say thank you to this woman. She has been a light for me. Thank you for accepting me for who I am and for showing me joy every day. Thank you!"

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Catherine and Johannes, who performed their Cha Cha to Scared Of The Dark by Steps, failed to impress all of the judges in the dance-off.

Craig Revel Horwood said: "One couple for me really stepped it up a notch. The couple I’d like to save is Mike & Katya."

But Motsi Mabuse wanted Catherine to stay in the competition and voted to send Mike home after his Tango to What You Waiting For by Gwen Stefani.

She said: "I felt a strong performance, stronger body actions, stronger leg actions. I’m saving Catherine & Johannes."

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

While Bruno Tonioli, who also voted to save Cath, said: "It’s hard because you’ve both done very, very well, but purely based on tonight I have to save the couple that got me tingling a little bit more and I have to save Catherine & Johannes."

Ultimately, the final decision came down to head judge Shirley Ballas.

Shirley said: "Well, I thought both couples really step it up a notch and this is always the most difficult decision for me.

"But based on a good focus, difficult content, with some really beautiful footwork in there with stronger technical skills for me, cleaner and polished. I’m going to save Mike & Katya."

(Image: BBC)

Fuming Strictly Come Dancing viewers took to Twitter to blast this week's result.

"Absolutely ridiculous result. What is going on? The mind boggles. Will miss Catherine and Johannes," said one viewer.

Another added: "Second bad decision, 1st Dev, now Catherine, might be my last season watching you judges are spoiling it"

"You should NOT have gone @Cath_Tyldesley absolutely scandalous decision by @ShirleyBallas you should be ashamed!!! You had far more potential!," said a third.

A fourth said: "I don't get why surely the judges must know they have made the wrong decision. What an absolute joke this programme has become this year"

*Strictly Come Dancing airs tonight on BBC One at 7.15pm
description: The former Coronation Street star and partner Johannes Radebe were sent home after a controversial dance-off with Mike Bushell and Katya Jones
